intro: Quercus sacame, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Quercus sacame typically grows in dry to mesic forests and is adapted to limestone soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and contributing to forest biodiversity.
